comments.body: For iron and gold you should get gold nuggets and iron nuggets not the full ingot
A good idea.  I have thought of some elaborations.  When a bucket of water is placed by a player, it has a 1% chance of dropping a gold nugget.

I like the idea of finding gold nuggets in streams, but I would propose a different method:

  • In river biomes (only), any sand mined had the same chance to convert into a gold nugget as gravel does to turn into flint.

(I initially thought on a prospecting pan where you would craft it and use it on water within rivers to get loot (similar to fishing) however I couldn't think on a good game mechanic for it to work)
Yes! This is great! Although, I was thinking of using a bowl with a cobweb or an iron bar in a crafting table, and I don‚Äôt agree with the mob heads. You gotta work for those.

Awesome, made a post about combining all the gold features into one update, Gold and Glory, if it's alright I'll add your idea and give you credit. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360050506192-Gold-and-Glory-Update

I was thinking that a good idea would be: You have to have sand in your iventory, then you use a bowl on a water block (possibly a moving water block) and it uses one sand block from your inventory and gives a chance to receive a gold nugget or two.

I agree with this idea, but just one thing. Maybe You shouldn't have a special pan for this, maybe you should just use a regular plate, you know, the one we use for soups. AND, instead of gold being common, you should make it really hard to find the nuggets, because in real life it takes a long time. So everything you can collect with the pan should be hard to get, like in real life. So maybe like a 10% chance or something. But anyways, love the idea, but just saying what I was going to post.
It would be great to have glass doors, as well as make recipes for the different colors.
A m√≠ me. Gustar√≠a por qu√© hay un YouTube que le gusta el chocolate a si que si hay cacao por qu√© no hacer una barra de chocolate

I think that chocolate would be a great addition to fill the gap in the hunger system of a kind of food that recovers a lot of hunger points but has a low saturation (so those hearts you quickly gained wither away just as fast).

That would be an excellent bailout in a moment of despair against a mob or PVP. If the player could eat it a bit faster than other foods, it would be extra useful.
I love your idea :D it would be hard to obtain because you would have to go to the end but it doesn't matter uwu

I add just in case:

I think a good place to find this mineral would be the End dimension since the endstone is one of the few desaturated colors that minecraft has, so the chalk would look good there + this would give a reason to return to this dimension more often + since the chalk is normally found under water, this could explain why the islands are floating in the air (the water descended to the overworld)

It could also be found a bit in the Overword, but the End would have a lot of it (like what happens with gold in the nether)
This is extremely well put together.
I feel like this would fit perfectly into the caves and cliffs update since there are such things as chalk cliffs and so chalk could equally be found on cliffs as well as the end.
Huge fan of this idea.Any new tone of colored blocks would be amazing for gradients and texturing,and we really need pastel colors in general.

Instead of Chalk, the new block could be called Plaster and be introduced when the Archaeology update is, because it ties in with plaster casts of artefacts etc.

Basically like concrete gives us vivid colours and terracotta gives us muddy colours, plaster would give us pastel colours and be crafted with bone meal.

However, I'm unsure what the other components would be. It could be that adding bone meal to concrete powder makes plaster, but the concrete recipe is already complex and non-renewable to craft so making plaster a tertiary crafting recipe seems messy. Or the plaster recipe could be bone meal + dye + bottles of water, but water bottles are non-stackable and then it would have to leave the water bottles in the crafting table. Or perhaps it could incorporate clay.

Either way, I think using bone meal in the recipe is most intuitive for players because you're using a whitish substance to get a light-coloured blockset, and because bones are made of plaster and plaster's components are calcium-based powders.
I think it should just give you +1 Armor when in the offhand.

Btw 

If anyone can see any issue with this idea let me know and if it sounds reasonable then I may add it
The piglin brute is made too add difficulty in the bastions remnant, so i don't think they would be add that.
The piglin brute is made too add difficulty in the bastions remnant, so i don't think they would be add that.

YES, please. I have been wondering this for a long time and was hoping we‚Äôd get more variation. It really is a shame we‚Äôre limited to Quartz and Purpur Pillars. I think the Sandstone, Blackstone, Prismarine and even Copper pillars would make excellent additions to add to the palate of builds.
Man I could really use this in my current build. Don't know why it's not a thing.
That's great
I think there are several threads talking about this.
how would you be able to craft it?

Yes! I agree, and with the upcoming Caves and Cliffs update in 1.17 hopefully they've added rope as this would be the perfect opportunity to do so! Imagine being able to explore a cave by repelling down via a rope. I think it would be nice if it was purchasable from the wandering trader as well, which has been suggested by SystemZee on YouTube.

You could just about easily take the same function of the lead right now. Able to anchor it from point to point, use it to climb, or as decoration. Perhaps make a recipe for it that is some kind of plant in the new swamp biome? Gives extra inventive to find the new biome and explore it beyond the hype that will come with a new place.
This is a fun idea, especially in icebergs, but it should be a rare chance.

maybe some smaller water mobs could also found in ice aswell! and it could be possible to achieve the effect manually by having something, such as a fish or an item, suspended in a water source block and having it freeze either naturally or by using the one boot enchantment that freezes water (i cant remember the name but i think it was something like ice walker). that way you could have something like a pufferfish frozen in an ice block.

It would be great if there was a higher chance of finding frozen items inside those big ice spike pillars and icebergs. I've always wanted a reason to explore inside of those but have never really had one. Right now, the really icy biomes are kind of useless, and this would give them a much-needed update.
This would also be cool for fossils!

Please be sure to check the category you are posting in! We've moved this for you - but remember that the Java Snapshot categories are temporary, and posts do get archived there! Don't lose your great ideas, be sure they go in the right place.
I like it. Snow bricks as well could work too for making more realistic looking igloos or fun snow fortresses
I like this idea, maybe it wouldn‚Äôt make you slide?
I need it
I completely agree, it could be really useful!
I remember seeing the white pumpkin in MC Story mode. It would be a great, yet simple little connection from the base game to story mode!

I even have an idea on how it can work:

If you plant pumpkin seeds into tilled soil, like usual, but replacing the dirt block, that would usually be next to the tilled soil for the pumpkin to grow on, with soul sand, will cause a white pumpkin to grow on the soulsand.

Carving the white pumpkin will give the pumpkin a skull texture.

Combining that Carved White Pumpkin with a blue torch, will make a Blue skull jack o lantern.

Now, imagine putting one of those, into a corner, and decorade the surroundings with a few skulls and wither skulls. It would make a fantastic decoration if you're going for creepiness.
While wearing a carved white pumpkin, all nearby enderman will become hostile. This would make it easier to get ender pearls and be a good reason for adding this to the game.
I can't wait to see new coloured pumpkins! üòÅ
This would be great for the new pale garden biome!
Or at the very least make is so that the trapdoor recipe makes 6 trap doors, so that both recipes consume and output the same volumes of wood.

Hi! I had a similar idea. Rather than make the same post, I think I'll just comment here. 

I agree with what another comment mentioned about the recipe producing 6 trapdoors instead of just two. Mathematically, it makes a lot of sense. 

The recipe for trapdoors is essentially the same as regular doors, just rotated. Since a trapdoor is half the size of a regular door, it should produce 6 trapdoors, which would equal the 3 regular doors we get from the door recipe. This would make it balanced and leave the door recipe the same. 

In the end, the door recipe is very balanced. A door is two blocks tall, so every two blocks of the recipe makes one door, resulting in 3 doors from the recipe. It should be the same for trapdoors. 

To the developers who work so hard on the game, I hope you consider this idea! I'm a builder and tend to go through a lot of wood on these details. It would mean so much if the trapdoor recipe could be more balanced with the door recipe. 

To the original poster, thank you for posting this! I hope the issue gets more attention. And sorry for my long rambly comment on your post, I'm just very passionate about these doors!
I feel like the trapdoor recipe should be a square of 4 blocks rather than 6 blocks since a trapdoor takes up half as much space as a normal door

I definitely agree with increasing the amount of trapdoors. It currently takes 3 wooden logs (12 planks) just to produce 4 trapdoors, which is more expensive than doors, stairs, fences, and other similar blocks that I can think of.
exactly! i think it's ridiculous that trapdoors, which are like a fifth or sixth of a block take more blocks from you than they give back

Given that the trapdoor is such a versatile, useful and beautiful block, I would also really like if the trapdoors became less expensive to craft. It feels quite bad to chop down half a forest only to be able to make like a stack of trapdoors.
It should have 1000 durability points and be only found in the mountains. It has 7 attack damage and diamond level armor points
The tools could also have faster attack speed than other tools, so the sword could have an attack speed of 2.0 for example, as titanium has a lower number on the periodic table compared to iron.
I would drop the battle axe and say just use a new set that's as effective as iron but more durability and is as rare as gold.
Like it.

I had a different crafting recipe in mind.  I was thinking that you'd put a dye on the bottom of the crafting grid, a glow ink sac in the center, then 7 end rods surrounding that.  It would give a use to an otherwise mundane 1.17 item too.  Let's hope these colored end rods get added.

What if - more intuitively - the End Rods (when crafted) would emit the light level of a soul lantern and when on an End City would emit the light level of a torch? The idea is that they can simply be clicked/tapped on with a dye in hand. Then, similar to signs, having Glow and normal Ink Sacs (respectively) glowing and un-glowing the End Rod!..

This would be far more intuitive for PE players, as well as reducing the overall item count, and including a new type of End Rod AND giving the Glow Ink Sac yet another use all in one neat little QoL feature!

Totally. End rods made sense having a purple base because the Purpure block was used. But then they changed the purple texture to a gray one even though the same type of block is used. Since lights are very important in Minecraft and we have to use them very often it would be nice to be able to have different types of colored end rods and finally emit their own luminous color.
This needs to be added. I would like to use neon lights and such in buildings without use of mods.
That can help find blazes to snag their rods...

I love this idea! Apparently, you and me are thinking alike, because a while later, I had the same idea. I didn't realize you thought of it first, but here is a quote from my suggestion "Sometimes when starting a new Minecraft world, nether fortresses are very difficult to find and other times they are relatively easy to find. It's almost like there's a 50% chance you'll find one only after a ton of digging, and a 50% chance it will pretty much be there. I feel that it is important to at least give players a way "out" so to speak by crafting some kind of locator. It could be expensive to craft, but the materials should still be accessible, probably from materials in the nether such as quartz, gold, and maybe some other more expensive materials. I think a simple way to do this would be to have a nether compass which points to the nearest nether fortress. To ensure that people can't craft one and use it forever, I think the compass should remember the coordinates of the nearest fortress as soon as it's first held. After that, it will stop searching for new nether fortresses and you will only be able to use that compass to find that fortress. Thanks for considering this idea! :)" I think this would be very cool and should definitely be added to the nether update!
With the addition of Piglin Bartering, perhaps they could have this as a trade?
This should make use of lodestone compasses and lodestones in the structures, with piglins bartering the connected compass
Yeah, I usually just look up where it is for the seed I'm using.

Finding a nether fortress is arguably the most disheartening and mundane portion of the Minecraft journey.

We have Eyes of Ender for finding the strongholds, why not have something to locate fortresses? A map of some kind makes the most sense to go along with the "lore" in Minecraft.

The map doesn't even have to lead directly to a fortress it could just highlight a region where one is so as to still give a sense of mystery and exploration as to the exact location.

Fortresses are simply too rare to not have some way of locating them somewhat easier.

It could be as simple as a rare drop from Piglins. Better yet, why not barter a very specific item to potentially get the map to a fortress from a Piglin?

Finding a fortress in the nether should not "require" the use of F3, a web-service to look up a chunk where one is located, or mindlessly wandering for extremely extended periods of time.

This small addition could expand the Minecraft journey quite a bit in entertainment for what would be getting added.

This item should totally be added to the game! I've never gotten to a nether fortress in survival, without using cheats, and I would agree that it is a very long and mundane task to find them. Just like you use the Eyes of Ender to find the End Portal, we should definitely have an item to help find the nether fortresses.

I think it could be like an Ender Eye, but crafted with Breeze Rods instead of Blaze Powder. Or, if that'd be too intrusive, maybe Piglins could sometimes give out compasses that come pre-attached to lodestones, and the lodestones are already inside the fortresses?

You can get name tags as loot from dungeons too. They are meant to inspire exploration. Making them craft-able would eliminate this treasure aspect of the name tag. Paper is super easy to acquire, maybe if they were crafted by an item that also requires exploration.
You can trade emeralds to villagers in return for a name tag, so name tags are completely renewable. Your post doesn't make any sense.

They need to add sulfur to the anticipated Volcano biome!

I think sulfur appearing as a new ore would be cool, but it should just spawn like any normal ore, except more commonly in the basalt delta. Perhaps a variant of blackstone could contain the ore, too. They should only craft a single gunpowder, though. 2 is too easy.

The sulfur block is cool, would be cool if it generated in the basalt delta, giving that biome more block variety. I don't think it should have a special fire color though.

Not sure about the light source idea, but the potion idea would be interesting. There might be a better material for making those potions though rather than sulfur.

I think it would be cool if the sulfur could be used as a coal alternative, except being too dangerous to use as furnace fuel, causing furnaces to explode, but it could make torches. However, this explosive nature could be exploited to make minecart furnaces move faster and thus have an actual use.

I‚Äôm glad I wasn‚Äôt the only person with this idea and keeping peaceful players in mind. I don‚Äôt play on peaceful very much myself, but late game gunpowder can become an essential material to have with access to elytras, and having a sulfur ore in the game would make it much, much easier for peaceful players to obtain gunpowder, as well as other players too. I think sulfur ore definitely has potential.

I love this idea. I would however make gunpowder using coal, sulfur and bone meal, as it is the recipe in Education Edition. It would be weird, if not unfair to change the recipe depending on the version, as they are the one, universal thing in every version of Minecraft.
I would also add another way to obtain it : eggs. Cook eggs, at which point they would become edible, then use it on your crafting table to extract sulfur.
Other than that, although the blue fire seens cool on paper, ingame it would only stand out and make sulfur just too awkward. Also, Soul Fire. It would easily get mixed up. The light-source block also seems uninspiring and complicated. I can't picture it in my head.

But besides everything this is a great idea that I would love to see arrive ingame, should ut get enough attention

An idea I have would have sulfur ore generate above Y-0 and exclusively in ore veins. This would encourage late game mining in the stone areas of the underground, so they could make TNT for the deepslate areas underground.

Sulfur ore should typically generate near the larger coal veins more frequently because concentrations of sulfur are relatively high in coal so it makes sense that sulfur ore would be near coal. Forms of sulfur in coal are typically not pure and include pyritic, organic and sulfate forms however elemental sulfur also can be found in in coal, albeit only in trace comparatively small quantities often barely qualifying as anything more than trace amounts.
lots of thought put into this, love it all! most of all, having an alternative way to get gunpowder which is one of the most crucial resources in the game is super important, especially on peaceful
Yes, we need a peaceful way of getting gunpowder.

Il me semble que dans les fichiers du jeu dans une certaine version la texture du ski est pr√©sente...mais on ne trouve pas de ski dans le jeu :/

I've created a post to expand on this idea a bit more but it got rejected so I'm leaving my feedback here:

Skiing used to be an important mode of transport in mountaineous regions of the world because it allows for speedy traversal of hills and mountain ranges both vertically and horizontally. Therefore it would be a useful and fun addition to the Caves & Cliffs update, which is going to introduce more verticality to the Minecraft world.

Skiers

  • Crafting recipe: 1x boot + 2x wooden slabs (-B-,W-W,---)
  • Used to traverse powdered snow without sinking in (creates particle effects)
  • Slide down/over blocks (fastest on ice blocks; fast on snow, snow-covered or carpet-covered blocks)
  • Slide uphill if there's enough momentum (could allow for ski jumping)
  • Increase speed continously by crouching while going downhill
  • Decrease speed by changing direction (more difficult with higher speed)
  • Can be combined with a minecart to create a sled (e.g. for transporting goods)
  • Right-click with shovel on snow to create skiing track (similar to paved grass) that's faster to traverse with skiers

Ski poles (optional for more control and for allowing cross-country skiing)

  • Crafting recipe: 4x wooden sticks (W-W,W-W,---)
  • Slide faster horizontally and uphill without any momentum, even on non-snow blocks
  • Allows for tighter turns while sliding downhill
  • Slide faster on paved grass blocks, which act as a skiing track
I want to create a ski resort with the new mountains and I think it would be awesome to be able to go on my runs I'll create.
This is a must have once the cliffs update comes out.

Minecraft actually used to have ski textures but it was only as a troll, although as they are making an update for mountains it would be pretty nice to be able to have a faster way of transportation through them, i imagine the skis controling a bit like a mix between elytras and boats, as it would accelerate with momentum when going down a snow block and you would use A and D to turn it.

I'm gonna give my view on what features I'd like the ender dragon to have, I'm sure many won't agree or will suggest alternatives... do so... this is just my opinion.

After battling the ender dragon 20x there is no more end gateways to unlock, as if battling him 20x wasn't enough there is absolutely no point in doing it again, there are easier ways to farm for xp and the dragon breath isn't really that useful, if at all. Having the dragon egg as decoration is cool and all but thats it.

It would be interesting if we could hatch it:

  • to have it has a pet that would grow if we wanted it to, so we could ride him & fly with him or just let him stay little, I think it would be cute (it would grow if fed with a food that would allow him to, different than feeding other food to replenish health);
  • breed him in a way that the kind of dragon would change depending on the enviroment (the egg would change color appropriately and the dragon skin);
  • being able to have more than one dragon (it could be done if the player fed him a special treat)
  • obviously after the dragon hatched it would have to be tamed, it would obey orders like the dog or cat in a way that it would stay put if he was lying down or following if he was standing, and perhaps shoot dragon breath.

 

(Part 1 of 2)

Giving a purpose to the egg & make going to the end more interesting. That way, the naturaly the generated mountains in the 1.18 - 1.19 would be an amazing place to make their nests & having them fly through the sky freely to a 100 block max extent from the player (with AI), making the sky more populated, and perhaps make some features related to the 1.19 update. Since, in the 1.19 we're gonna have a beast underground (warden), why not have useful cool one above ground that is the players pet (dragon).

PS: the dragons that aren't tamed can fly around the parent if they are little or fly  through the sky if they are older, and no be bound by the 100 bock max distance from the player, other cool things can be implemented if it is so decided after, of course that the stats and such would have to be decided in a way that would'nt be to op, nor would the dragon be able to destroy blocks.

There is a mod that allows some of thing mentioned in this comment and previous one but I'd like it to be an official feature/release of the game, I won't put the link to the mod since I don't know if I'm allowed to, but if the moderators or devs want to know just inform me. (Sorry but I couldn't fit it all 1 comment)

Also there are some points that repeate perhaps somethings discussed in other threads, I apologise.

(Part 2 of 2)

I think that you should make it so that you hatch the egg in the end and than it will grow and when its full grown you have to fight it again and the fight is harder. could you do that? it would add purpose to the egg.
